item.title: fuzzy hashing
item.description: Fuzzy hashing helps us to perform similarity analysis - match two files with minor differences based on the fuzzy hash values. One of the examples of fuzzy hashing is the usage of SSDeep.

item.title: EscapeTwo
item.description: Machine Info: - Easy - Windows - IP: 10.129.240.7 - Incomplete Steps 1. Reconnainsce Nmap Scan Command nmap -sV -oA EasyTwo-nmap 10.129.240.7 --open Result PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION 53/tcp open domain Simple DNS Plus 88/tcp open kerberos-sec Microsoft Windows Kerberos (server time: 2025-01-12 08:20:02Z) 135/tcp open msrpc Microsoft Windows RPC 139/tcp open netbios-ssn Microsoft Windows netbios-ssn 445/tcp open microsoft-ds? 464/tcp open kpasswd5? 593/tcp open ncacn_http Microsoft Windows RPC over HTTP 1.0 636/tcp open ssl/ldap Microsoft Windows Active Directory LDAP (Domain: sequel.htb0., Site: Default-First-Site-Name) 1433/tcp open ms-sql-s Microsoft SQL Server 2019 15.00.2000 3269/tcp open ssl/globalcatLDAPssl? Service Info: Host: DC01; OS: Windows; CPE: cpe:/o:microsoft:windows.

item.title: Phishing Email
item.description: About Your email address has been leaked and you receive an email from Paypal in German. Try to analyze the suspicious email. File location: C:\Users\LetsDefend\Desktop\Files\PhishingChallenge.zip Password: infected This challenge prepared by @Fuuji Walkthroughs: DFIR Challenge - Phishing Email Phishing Email Challenge & Step-by-Step SOC Alert Investigations Phishing Email Challenge by LetsDefend E-mail Analysis - A LetsDefend Challenge Questions What is the return path of the email? → bounce@rjttznyzjjzydnillquh.designclub.uk.com What is the domain name of the url in this mail? → storage.googleapis.com Is the domain mentioned in the previous question suspicious? → yes What is the body SHA-256 of the domain? → 13945ecc33afee74ac7f72e1d5bb73050894356c4bf63d02a1a53e76830567f5 Is this email a phishing email? → Yes Analysis The file contained the copy of email which was sent to us.
